intro: Roettlera anachoreta, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Roettlera anachoreta is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
